entry.title: Newsletter #67
entry.content:
Hello folks!

News from the tech team:

Hurray! Namshi turned 3 and we are having a party :). Lucio, Alex, Oba are off to Amsterdam for the dockercon. We hope they are enjoying and get the latest insights about docker. If you are at the dockercon, don’t miss the opportunity to talk to our fellows there, as you know we are hiring.

It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the weekend:

  • Symfony2 specification by examples

  • BDD – its about value

  • Code Quality By The Numbers – Slides

  • 5 Things a Beginner Developer (and Tester) Should Know About Software Testing

  • List of great dev ops tools

  • Centralized Logging with Logstash and Elasticsearch

  • Schemalessness Gone Wrong: How We Improved Elasticsearch Indexing

  • Creating an advanced Kibana dashboard using a script

  • What About Garbage?

  • Always Multiply Your Estimates by π

  • Why I Like XSLT

  • YOU ARE NOT YOUR RESUME

  • Using JSON Web Tokens as API Keys

  • Static Typing Is Not for Type Checking

  • Google’s mysterious Foobar hiring program investigated

  • Are you a robot? Introducing “No CAPTCHA reCAPTCHA”

  • io,js: nodejs has been forked!

  • Product development = tradeoffs

  • hack.summit(): a real inspiring presentation by Fabien Potencier

  • composer is now faster than before

  • Mermaid: generation of diagram and flowchart from text in a similar manner as markdown

entry.title: Newsletter #66
entry.content:
Hey folks from the software engineering community!

It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

Our comrade Alex is at SymfonyCon Madrid with an awesome and super exciting talk about angular.

Next week, Oba, Lucio and Alex will be at the super exciting Docker Eu Conference to collect some thoughts about the newest technologies.

Here is the list with awesome links to keep you busy during the week:

  • A Programmer Describes How He Nearly Went Insane Learning To Code

  • Codewars, improve your programming skills

  • React Tube Tracker – a simple application to check the predicted arrival times of trains at stations on the London Underground network built with React.

  • Yahoo! Mail moving to React

  • Docker vs VMs

  • Create your own Docker image

  • Service discovery with consul and consul-template

  • Building a complete Tweet index
